page.title: 04THE NW EDGE OF CHELTENHAM
page.content: A mix of{farmland,}nurseries, resid- ential, industrial and unused land a- waiting development. At Swindon Farm 70% of the cereal crop is fed to beef stock.A farm shop sells potatoes.{ Nurseries are family concerns growing flowers, vegetables and salad crops on good soft loam. The produce is grown either outside or in polythene houses for sale on site or at market. An interesting feature of the residential use of the area can be seen in Homecroft Drive. Ten of these {houses}were built in 1926 as part of the Cheltenham Homecroft Housing Association Scheme when, after World War 1, chosen areas of particular towns were encouraged to survive as self-sufficient communities.Two of the properties still retain many of the original features but the rest have been modernised.
